stockmarket.gui.dialog

Class ExceptionDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • stockmarket.gui.dialog.AbstractListenerDialog
      • stockmarket.gui.dialog.AbstractDefaultDialog
        • stockmarket.gui.dialog.ExceptionDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, ListenerDialog, ListenerView

    @NotThreadSafe
public class ExceptionDialog
extends AbstractDefaultDialog
    A standard dialog generated when an exception occurs during the program. The dialog contains a simple message about the nature of the exception, and the option to expand and show a detailed stack trace.

    If this dialog is displayed before the setThrowable() method has been called and a Throwable object passed to it, most of the dialog will be blank. The text is set based on the Throwable it is displaying.

    THREAD SAFETY: Swing is NOT thread safe.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig

      • main

      • getValueForAction

        public java.lang.Object getValueForAction(java.lang.String valueToGet)
        Description copied from interface: ListenerView
        Returns a value from the view that is needed to perform a given action. The actionCommand parameter passed here determines which, if any, value will be returned. If no value is needed for a particular action, simply return null.

        THREAD SAFETY: Again, this is a Swing class. Controllers that off-load their tasks to other threads need to make sure that they only call on this method on the EventDispatchThread.

        Parameters:
        valueToGet - the action command for the action being performed, to determine which, if any, values are needed from this view.
        Returns:
        the value needed for the specified action, or null if no value is needed.

      • addButtons

        protected javax.swing.JButton[] addButtons()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDefaultDialog
        Adds buttons to the bottom button panel of the dialog. These buttons are returned in an array, and will be added from left-to-right in the order they appear in the array. All buttons will be right-aligned in the panel.
        Specified by:
        addButtons in class AbstractDefaultDialog
        Returns:
        an array of the buttons to add to the button panel.
